Our short film ‘Burning Hearts’ is now online.

Watch it above or in the cinema section to the right.

Here is a review from the recent Glasgow Film Festival:

“If I’m to be sincere, from all the different fiction works included in the international sections, there was only one which truly amazed me. I won’t discuss some of the flaws of the work, as that leads nowhere.

Burning hearts is one of those works made with naturalness and courage, a kamikaze short film, with no prejudice in making a U turn in its plot just to take us into a vortex of blood and kung fu. The Japanese short film by James Mcfay is just like that; you take it or leave it.

I’ll take it.”

-Jorge Rivero

Article.Subtitle: Cambridge Film Festival + Other Stuff
Article.Html: Burning Hearts will make it’s UK premiere this month at the Cambridge Film Festival:

For those asking, all screenings of Burning Hearts prior to June 2012 were of a work-in-progress (unfinished grade, soundtrack and FX).

Burning Hearts, in its finished state, made its world premiere in June at the Sydney Film Festival. Cambridge will be its third proper screening after the Cannes short film corner.

In other news, Beaufort’s book of short stories is almost finished (only six years in the making!) and some new music will be on our Soundcloud player before the year is out.

Beaufort is the collective name for some of the projects initiated by James McFay.

The word comes from the most ridiculously French name I could think of when I was asked to DJ at a French House night in 2006.

I later used it for the music video Fun Punch in order to avoid legal action.

Nothing on this site could have been made without the collaborations of many people, so it made sense to do it under this umbrella name.
